citation.article-title: The Nocardia salmonicida clade, including descriptions of Nocardia cummidelens sp. nov., Nocardia fluminea sp. nov. and Nocardia soli sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nocardia soli sp. nov.
Nocardia soli (so.lum. L. n. solum, from the soil)
Brown to pale orange colonies with sparse aerial hyphae formed on GYEA.
Colony elevation is convex to irregular and colony margins filamentous.
Arbutin is hydrolysed but hippurate is not.
Degrades Tweens 20, 40 and 60 but not cellulose, chitin, Tween 80 or xylan.
Grows on glucose (1%, w/v), glycerol (1%, w/v) and sodium butyrate (0.1%, w/v) as sole sources of carbon for energy and growth, but not on meso-inositol (1%, w/v) or sodium acetate (0.1%, w/v).
Grows well at 10 and 30°C and between pH 5 and 10.

Resistant to lysozyme but sensitive to cephaloridine hydrochloride (16 µg ml-11), demethylchlortetracycline hydrochloride (16), gentamicin sulphate (8), rifampicin (1), streptomycin sulphate (16) and tobramycin sulphate (1).
Additional phenotypic properties are shown in Table 2.
Isolated from River Thames water, Medmenham, UK.
